title: Rome IV Diagnostic Criteria for Infant Functional Diarrhea
desc: The Rome IV Criteria for Infant Functional Diarrhea provides criteria for the diagnosis of infant functional diarrhea.

orgreference.text: Benninga MA, Faure C, Hyman PE, St james roberts I, Schechter NL, Nurko S. Childhood Functional Gastrointestinal Disorders: Neonate/Toddler. Gastroenterology. 2016; 1443-1455.

other_refer.text: Hoekstra J, van den Aker J, Hartemink R, Kneepkens C. Fruit juice malabsorption: not only fructose. Acta Paediatrica. 1995;84(11):1241-1244.
Kneepkens CMF, Hoekstra JH. Chronic nonspecific diarrhea of childhood. Pediatric Clinics of North America. 1996;43(2):375-390.
Drossman DA, Chang L, Rome Foundation (Raleigh). Rome IV Pediatric Functional Gastrointestinal Disorders: Disorders of Gut-Brain Interaction. Rome Foundation; 2016.

data.evidence:
To fulfill the Rome IV criteria for infant functional diarrhea, patient must have the following:

  1. Daily, painless, recurrent passage of ≥4 large, unformed stools.
  2. Symptoms last >4 weeks.
  3. Onset between 6 and 60 months of age.
  4. No failure to thrive if caloric intake is adequate.
